excerpt: Museum featuring Italian art from the 13th century to the 1700s, including the Renaissance.
detail_description: The Pinacoteca Nazionale di Bologna is a museum showcasing Italian art from the 13th century to the 1700s, with a focus on Renaissance works. Situated in close proximity to several significant cultural and educational institutions, including the Science Institute and the Academy of Fine Arts, this museum features 30 halls for permanent exhibitions as well as spaces for temporary displays, workshops, and conferences.
name: Pinacoteca Nazionale di Bologna
address: Via delle Belle Arti, 56, 40126 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Vast Gothic basilica with an unfinished brick & marble facade, housing 22 art-filled side chapels.
detail_description: Basilica di San Petronio is a grand Gothic basilica in Bologna, dedicated to the city's patron saint, Petronius. The 14th-century edifice boasts an unfinished brick and marble facade and houses 22 art-filled side chapels. It stands as one of Italy's most monumental Gothic basilicas, with a capacity for up to 28,000 people.
name: Basilica di San Petronio
address: Piazza Maggiore, 40124 Bologna BO, Italy

detail_description: Piazza Maggiore is the main square in the heart of Bologna, Italy. It is surrounded by some of the city's most important buildings and has been a central gathering place for locals and visitors for centuries. The square is lined with cafes, restaurants, and shops, making it a lively hub of activity. Visitors can admire the beautiful architecture, including the Basilica of San Petronio and the Palazzo d'Accursio.
name: Piazza Maggiore
address: Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Bologna is the lively, historic capital of the Emilia-Romagna region, in northern Italy. Its Piazza Maggiore is a sprawling plaza lined with arched colonnades, cafes and medieval and Renaissance structures such as City Hall, the Fountain of Neptune and the Basilica di San Petronio. Among the cityâ€™s many medieval towers are the Two Towers, leaning Asinelli and Garisenda.
detail_description: Bologna, the vibrant capital of the Emilia-Romagna region in northern Italy, is a city steeped in history and charm. Its Piazza Maggiore boasts stunning medieval and Renaissance architecture, including the iconic Two Towers. The city's elegant arcades create a romantic atmosphere as they wind through the pedestrianized center, where you'll find an array of fine dining establishments and lively bars. Bologna offers a range of accommodations, from converted palazzos to chic contemporary hotels.
name: Bologna
address: Metropolitan City of Bologna, Italy

excerpt: Lively indoor market with stalls supplying local produce, meats & cheeses, plus dining options.
detail_description: Mercato delle Erbe is the largest indoor market in Bologna, offering a wide array of fresh local produce, meats, cheeses, and other specialties. In addition to being a bustling marketplace, it has also become a popular dining destination with various food stalls and eateries serving traditional Italian dishes as well as international cuisine.
name: Mercato delle Erbe
address: Via Ugo Bassi, 25, 40121 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Hilltop, baroque-style Roman Catholic sanctuary church, dedicated to the Virgin Mary, with a cupola.
detail_description: Santuario Madonna di San Luca is a stunning hilltop Roman Catholic sanctuary church in Bologna, Italy. The baroque-style church is dedicated to the Virgin Mary and features a beautiful cupola. Visitors can embark on a scenic CAI trail that starts in Bologna and follows the arcades of San Luca, offering breathtaking views as it passes through Casalecchio and ends in Sasso Marconi at the Ponte di Vizzano.
name: Santuario Madonna di San Luca
address: Via di San Luca, 36, 40135 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Lively covered food market with pasta, meat & cheese, pizza & drinks, plus table seating.
detail_description: Mercato di Mezzo is a vibrant covered food market located in the heart of Bologna's Quadrilatero. Recently renovated and reopened, this historic market spans 700 square meters across three levels. It offers a variety of local specialties such as fresh pasta, salumi, cheeses, piadine, tigelle, wines from the Enoteca Regionale Emilia-Romagna, craft beer, gourmet sandwiches, and sweets.
name: Mercato di Mezzo
address: Via Clavature, 12, 40124 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Spurting mermaids surrounding a vast 16th-century fountain topped with the bronze figure of Neptune.
detail_description: Neptune's Fountain, also known as the Fountain of Neptune (Fontana del Nettuno), is a stunning 16th-century fountain located in Bologna. This magnificent work of art was created by Giambologna and commissioned to glorify the papal government of Pope Pius IV. The fountain stands in the center of Piazza del Nettuno and features a bronze statue of Neptune atop a pedestal, surrounded by spurting mermaids and four heraldic dolphins representing rivers from different continents.
name: Neptune's Fountain
address: Piazza del Nettuno, 40124 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Prominent historic basilica with a Romanesque facade, many paintings & Saint Dominic's remains.
detail_description: The Basilica of San Domenico in Bologna is a significant historic site with a Romanesque facade and houses the remains of Saint Dominic, the founder of the Dominican order. The church features an array of remarkable artworks by renowned artists such as Guercino, Filippino Lippi, and Ludovico Carracci.
name: Basilica of San Domenico
address: P.za S. Domenico, 13, 40124 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Cluster of chapels, crypts & vaults built over centuries, displaying remains of medieval frescoes.
detail_description: The Basilica Santuario Santo Stefano, also known as the Complesso delle Sette Chiese or Seven Churches, is a remarkable cluster of chapels, crypts, and vaults that were built over several centuries. This complex includes the Church of the Crucifix, the Basilica del Sepolcro, the Church of San Vitale, and Sant'Agricola among others.
name: Basilica Santuario Santo Stefano - Complesso delle Sette Chiese
address: Via Santo Stefano, 24, 40125 Bologna BO, Italy

detail_description: Quadrilatero, also known as Bologna's immortal quarter, is a historic area filled with stories of art, love, and trade. The streets have witnessed centuries of human interactions and are home to the Albergo delle Drapperie, where people from around the world have met and shared their experiences.
name: Quadrilatero
address: Bologna, Metropolitan City of Bologna, Italy

excerpt: Art museum with permanent collection from 1945 to the present, plus temporary contemporary shows.
detail_description: MAMbo - Museo d'Arte Moderna di Bologna, also known as Bologna's Museum of Modern Art, is a vibrant cultural institution that opened in 2007. Housed in the former Forno del Pane, it offers a comprehensive exploration of Italian art from the post-World War II era to the present day. The museum actively engages with contemporary art through temporary exhibitions and innovative artistic practices.
name: MAMbo - Museo d'Arte Moderna di Bologna
address: Via Don Giovanni Minzoni, 14, 40121 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Catholic church restored in the 17th & 18th centuries, with a tall bell tower & frescoes.
detail_description: Cattedrale Metropolitana di San Pietro, also known as the Duomo di San Pietro, is a Catholic church in Bologna dedicated to the city's patron saint, Petronius. The church was restored in the 17th and 18th centuries and features a tall bell tower and frescoes.
name: Cattedrale Metropolitana di San Pietro
address: Via dell'Indipendenza, 7, 40125 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Town hall complex dating from the 14th century, home to a fresco-filled chapel & fine art museum.
detail_description: Palazzo d'Accursio is a historic town hall complex in Bologna, dating back to the 14th century. It is situated in the city center, surrounded by important public buildings and cultural landmarks such as Palazzo Re Enzo, Palazzo del Podesta, Basilica di San Petronio, Fontana del Nettuno, Palazzo dei Notai, and Palazzo de Banchi. The complex also includes a chapel adorned with frescoes and a fine art museum.
name: Palazzo d'Accursio
address: Piazza Maggiore, 6, 40121 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Museum with recovered airplane parts & objects from an unsolved crash that occurred in 1980.
detail_description: The Museum for the Memory of Ustica is a historical museum that houses recovered airplane parts and objects from an unsolved crash that occurred in 1980. The exhibit provides a solemn tribute to the victims of the tragedy, where visitors can enter a room below ground level to see the wreckage of the plane. The display serves as a reminder of our human capacity for memory and how it shapes who we are. In addition, Christian Boltanski's installation adds personal depth to the dismantled aircraft.
name: Museo per la Memoria di Ustica
address: Via di Saliceto, 3/22, 40128 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Library & anatomical theater in a 16th-century building with frescoes & an array of coats of arms.
detail_description: Biblioteca Comunale dell'Archiginnasio is a historic building in Bologna that served as the first seat of the University of Bologna. The Anatomical Theatre inside the Archiginnasio provides insight into the early scientific studies of the human body, featuring anatomical models and statues of renowned physicians. The Palazzo dell'Archiginnasio, now housing the municipal library, was constructed in record time to provide a unified space for various academic disciplines.
name: Biblioteca Comunale dell'Archiginnasio
address: P.zza Galvani, 1, 40124 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Popular public park with lots of trees, a lake & lawns, plus a jogging path & play areas for kids.
detail_description: Giardini Margherita is Bologna's largest and most popular park, attracting locals and tourists alike. As the sun sets, it becomes a favorite spot to unwind and enjoy the transformation of the sky. The park features a jogging path, play areas for kids, a lake, and plenty of trees and lawns. It offers a serene atmosphere for visitors to relax with blankets, wine, and nibbles while soaking up the warm evening ambiance.
name: Giardini Margherita
address: Viale Giovanni Gozzadini, 40136 Bologna BO, Italy

detail_description: IQOS PARTNER - Tabaccheria La Piazzola is a historic market located in the Piazza dell Agosto in Bologna. With over 400 stalls, it offers a wide variety of items for sale, including clothes, shoes, fashion accessories, flowers, pottery and jewelry. It has been popular with both locals and tourists for many years.
name: IQOS RESELLER - Tabaccheria La Piazzola, Bologna
address: Via Irnerio, 5c, 40126 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: History & culture of Bologna explored through relics & multimedia exhibits in a palace museum.
detail_description: Palazzo Pepoli - Museo della Storia di Bologna is a captivating museum housed in the grand Palazzo Pepoli, offering an immersive journey through the history and culture of Bologna. The museum, which opened in 2012, features interactive exhibits that bring to life the city's 2500-year history. Visitors can explore 35 themed rooms showcasing ancient relics and multimedia presentations.
name: Palazzo Pepoli - Museo della Storia di Bologna
address: Via Castiglione, 10, 40125 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Small plaza adjacent to the Piazza Maggiore known for its iconic, 16th-century Fountain of Neptune.
detail_description: Piazza del Nettuno is a small plaza located next to the Piazza Maggiore in Bologna. It is famous for being home to the iconic Fountain of Neptune, which features a striking bronze statue of Neptune created by the Flemish sculptor Giambologna in 1564. The fountain quickly became controversial due to its nudity and the erotic nature of the female figures spouting water from their breasts.
name: Piazza del Nettuno
address: Bologna BO, Italy
